page.title: 10Willoughby Line Reserve
page.content: This particular section of branch line, once owned by the L.N.E.R. and running to Mablethorpe and beyond is now owned by the Lincs and S.Humberside Trust. Some of the line has been ploughed up near Willoughby but the rest has been maintained to the Trust Standard applied to all reserves. Much of the land is rough grass on the old rail bed. This is the haunt of Small Blue and Common Blue butterflies in summer. The line is bordered for much of its length by Hawthorn with occasional clumps of Birch. To the south of the line and only accessible from it is a private fishing pond, thickly bordered by trees, especially Willow and Ash. This area provides good cover for birds, particularly Blackcap warblers and Reed Warblers. Cuckoos are common residents in season
